steps.details: BWSSB SCADA to pinpoint the rupture via pressure telemetry and field probes.
Issue advisories on possible supply disruption and contamination; request water conservation.
Mobilize BWSSB repair teams with pumps, valves and spares to the suspected 30th Cross area.
Prepare water tankers to service critical facilities and affected households.
Lab test water quality at distribution endpoints and issue boil-water notices if needed.
Close affected intersections and divert traffic to avoid accidents and two-wheeler skids.
Activate emergency pumps to remove standing water and protect adjacent properties.
Provide help to stranded two-wheeler riders and elderly pedestrians; arrange temporary shelters.
Implement diversion plans and place signage to manage flow.
Record property and road damage for repair prioritization and insurance claims.
BESCOM to perform preventive shutdown of distribution transformer at risk of water ingress.
Provide alternate supply to essential services where possible and prioritize restoration post-clearance.
Coordinate with BBMP for temporary shelter and potable water distribution for impacted residents.
Inspect electrical infrastructure post-inundation before re-energizing to avoid short-circuits.
Schedule expedited transformer repairs and road reinstatement once waters recede.
